headline: Fed cuts rates amid division among governors over US economy
subhead: On December 10, the US central bank reduced its rates by a quarter of a point. Donald Trump is expected to name the successor to its chair, Jerome Powell, in the days to come.

headline: Jewels of power go on display in Paris
subhead: Opals and cameos belonging to Empress Josephine, an emerald tiara once worn by Queen Victoria, diamond aigrettes from maharajas:  At the Hôtel de la Marine, the exhibition 'Dynastic Jewels' offers a rare glimpse into the jewelry collections of historical figures.

headline: PSG mulls locations for new home, pending local elections
subhead: After several years of unsuccessful talks with City Hall regarding the purchase of the Parc des Princes, the club is conducting in-depth studies in Massy and Poissy, two cities in the Paris region, for the construction of a new home ground.

subhead: Following a December 7 coup attempt in Benin, Cameroonian philosopher and political scientist Achille Mbembe believes that Africa is now a continent where 'force and power are stripped down to the essentials.'

headline: France's far-right Rassemblement National wants to reopen brothels
subhead: MP Jean-Philippe Tanguy, who is preparing a bill to create cooperatives managed by sex workers themselves, says penalizing customers has worsened the situation of sex workers.

headline: Japan sees disinformation spread as right-wing influence grows
subhead: Japan's political and social crises have fueled a climate of anxiety and a surge in right-wing radicalization, notably among young people. The right has taken advantage of this to whitewash the facts of the war (1931-1945).
